The amenokal may have limited authority over the various tribes, but the chief of each (amrar) has considerable authority
he has retainers to handle his property

"The amenokal lives like his subjects, although a little more luxuriously; there is virtually no ceremony surrounding his person. Each arrival presents himself before his [the amenokal’s] tent, without further formality. There is neither a court nor the etiquette of a court. Only the Tobol [drum], which is usually placed at the entrance to the tent, indicates the status of its owner"

drum
arbitration, conciliation
The primary function of the supra-tribal leader (amenokal) is that of war chief

Tuareg were exposed early to Islam, but it appears to have become dominant among them only recently. Pagan survivals remain, and Islamic law is observed in fragments. Scoring is for the traits reported by Lhote (1955: 339ff), with guesses influenced by what are the Islamic practices in each case
